column4: I need to automagically setup a wireless network using the command line.  The ESSID and key are known.  Does anybody have *any* idea how to do this?
look at iwconfig, the manual is at `man iwconfig`
it's too durned complicated for me :p
do you know the interface name of your wireless card?
it's made more difficult because I'm trying to walk somebody else through it and I've never set up a wireless network before. :p
and then watch iw..log i think it is....iw then press tab, theres a wireless interface log
should 'sudo iwconfig interface [essid]  [essid]  key [key] ;sudo ifup [interface] ' work, in your estimation?
it is: 'sudo iwconfig interface essid [essid] '....im not sure what u need to do after that
i would do `sudo ifdown interface`, then `sudo dhclient interface`...u should be good to go
after the ESSID thing that is..and watch the wireless interface log
